content: The Django version for the current self hosted Zulip version, 1.11, seems fairly old since the current stable version is 3.1. Are you planning to keep this version in the long term or will it be upgraded at some stage? Out of curiosity, I am wondering whether upgrading to a newer version would be technically problematic for the Zulip project.
@Plankter the Django version has been 2.2 on master since #13819 was merged.
Yes, and we don't want to upgrade to Django 3 largely because it is effectively a beta at the moment.
See https://www.djangoproject.com/download/; the latest Django 3.x release, 3.0.7, is expected to reach EOL in August.
I imagine we will move to Django 3.2 LTS as soon as that's released.
